meanings.definition: To lift or pull abruptly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She hoicked the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He hoicked the suitcase up the stairs.
meanings.sent3: The little girl hoicked her teddy bear into the air for fun.
meanings.sent4: The crane hoicked the car out of the ditch effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The magician hoicked the rabbit out of the hat with a flourish.

meanings.definition: To move or carry with great effort or force.
meanings.sent1: They hoicked the fallen tree out of the way.
meanings.sent2: The workers hoicked the heavy equipment across the field.
meanings.sent3: The team hoicked the giant pumpkin to the competition.
meanings.sent4: The wind hoicked the leaves off the ground in a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The determined ant hoicked the food back to the nest.
